Why is this Adobe CVE included in the Security Update Guide? 
The vulnerability assigned to this CVE is in Adobe software which is consumed by Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based).  It is being documented in the Security Update Guide to announce that the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is no longer vulnerable. 
How can I see the version of the browser? 
In your Microsoft Edge browser, click on the 3 dots (...) on the very right-hand side of the window

metadata.title: CVE-2023-44323 Adobe: CVE-2023-44323 Adobe PDF Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
metadata.summary: Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) is affected by the Adobe PDF Remote Code Execution Vulnerability, identified as CVE-2023-44323. This vulnerability allows remote code execution and is considered to have a moderate severity. The vulnerability is in Adobe software consumed by Microsoft Edge, and the latest version of Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) with build number 118.0.2088.76 is no longer vulnerable. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the victim's system. Microsoft has provided a solution by releasing a security update for Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) to address this vulnerability. System administrators are advised to update their Microsoft Edge installations to the latest version (118.0.2088.76) to mitigate the risk of exploitation. For more information, refer to the Microsoft Security Update Guide.
metadata.nvd_description: adobe acrobat for edge version 118.0.2088.46 (and earlier) is affected by a use after free vulnerability. an unauthenticated attacker could leverage this vulnerability to achieve an application denial-of-service in the context of the current user. exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.
